column5: Well been in Toronto a week now and managed to get out 3 times fishing, 1st time I went down the waterfront and managed to carp on surface baits, one a high single, then the other a mid teen.  Went again yesterday, managed to get a few follows on the spinners but nothing else.  Then decided on the islands today so got the ferry at 11 and fished til about 5  Got a very good carp, chuffed to bits with it, got to be a high 20, in the 26lb-29lb bracket going off similar fish Ive caught in the uk. Baited up an area Id seen them and left it to rest for half an hr then returned to catch this nice common. 8lb main line, with a 6lb hooklink.  Thats a 2 foot landing net to give you an idea, and it was one FAT fish    Also managed to get two pike on the spinners, unfortunately I only got a picture of the smaller, as I unhooked the larger one in the water and let it go before I realised.  Biggest one was about 9lb, and then there was this one at about 3-4lb, all in all a good day tho.    Also had the joy of meeting a number of friendly people fishing who where happy enough for a quick chat, including the 2 daves (one being master basser) nice to meet you
Well you're not wasting any time....good show!  I don't think I've ever heard of someone getting carp on surface baits...what's the trick?
I catch half of my carp back in England on surface baits, its all about getting the confidence of the fish up, which isnt such an issue here as theres very little pressure on the fish from anglers
Nice carp man!  That must have been a blast to do battle with.  Congrats.

Good show.  Dem's some dandies!  Surprised I havn't run into ya.  Water's been real hazy since the downpour on Sat but there's been some fishable water east of our building.. lotsa fish in the high 30s..  tomorrow night.. ya down?!  cheers HD  OFC... dating service for fisherfolk?!
Well done Ben  You're lucky to be living so close to harbourfront.  No doubt I'll be making the pilgrimage to the islands very soon for carp...Hope to run into you down there.
looks massive, congrats on the fish!!! now you know you need bigger net.
Nice fish! Congrats on them all!
Great stuff Ben, welcome to canada from a fellow ex-pat. That is one hell of a carp.  keep up the good work...and dont try too hard finding a job
Nice report man, some nice fish as well. Hopefully your transition will go as smoothly as possible. Keep it up

Well, Ive been flat out with interviews and managed to land myself work as a construction estimator down in missisauga, start on tuesday. just need to figure out the best public transport routes for it now, but the fishing will have to be left for weekends and evenings
Congrats on the fish and the job.  You're a lucky git.  lol just kidding.
very nice report and great fish!
Very nice fish! Must have took you sometime to bring in with 6lb hooklink !  Congrats on a great day out, you seem to be fitting into the area just fine. Thanks for sharing.
beauty fish there Ben, and congrats on the new job...as for getting there, where are you going from and too, some here might be able to help you out with the best route....  Maureen
Nice job, must of been a long fight with that carp and light line.  Thanks for sharing,  MTBF
Maureen, Ive started another topic on it, but it would be good if people could give me some pointers  http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=32008
nice stuff!  Is that i type R as your avatar? looks great!  Cheers,  Yv
Its my Peugeot 306 Rallye. Full track/race spec, currently in storage while Im here
It is not a Honda, it is a Peugeot
